channel.title: Amination
channel.description: Hi, i have a quick question if anyone has a moment. I'm new to messing around with the sprites so not really sure atm, So i was wanting to add new armours and stuff just to mess around and get familiar with how all the sprites\items work. So I added it to aminations items.def\rscd and itemwieldable. But how do i know which sprite\type to get the new amination? I tried looking at rune addy and ect, it looked like the type was the same. for instance 644 is legs. and then the sprite would be 42 for rune 41 for addy 43 for black 44 for iron ect. how would I find which amination is the one with my color? I don't think i'd haft to add a completley new sprite for the armour since all the armours are based off the origional sprite just with color variations. any thoughtS?

item.title: Amination
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

remenissions:

Hey thanks that did it for me yong min

No problem.

@chaw, if I can be arsed and have some spare time, I will do.

Read full topic

item.title: Amination
item.dc:creator: @remenissions remenissions
item.description:
@remenissions wrote:

Hey thanks that did it for me yong min

Read full topic

item.title: Amination
item.dc:creator: @chaw111 chaw111
item.description:
@chaw111 wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:9, topic:338516”]Hello there, remenissions…

If you are wanting to just change the inventory sprite, then all you do is take your new sprite, minus 2150 from that number, which will give you the sprite to use in your ItemDef.xml and Items.rscd.

For example:

If you take a look at the Dragon Sword XML entry:

Dragon sword A Razor sharp sword [b]273[/b] 100000 false true 16711748

The sprite here for the Dragon Sword (in the inventory), is 273. But the actual sprite’s number in your Sprites.rscd for the Dragon Sword will be 2423.

2423 - 273 = 2150

I hope this explains to you how to assign a sprite to an inventory image.[/quote]

can you make a tut on how to change the wieldable look?

Read full topic

item.title: Amination
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Hello there, remenissions…

If you are wanting to just change the inventory sprite, then all you do is take your new sprite, minus 2150 from that number, which will give you the sprite to use in your ItemDef.xml and Items.rscd.

For example:

If you take a look at the Dragon Sword XML entry:

Dragon sword A Razor sharp sword [b]273[/b] 100000 false true 16711748

The sprite here for the Dragon Sword (in the inventory), is 273. But the actual sprite’s number in your Sprites.rscd for the Dragon Sword will be 2423.

2423 - 273 = 2150

I hope this explains to you how to assign a sprite to an inventory image.

Read full topic

item.title: Amination
item.dc:creator: @remenissions remenissions
item.description:
@remenissions wrote:

Well I want to add a new sprite just for unwieldable items. But i don’t exactly understand the whole process. Like I unpack it I look at the png’s, I added an extra item just for something simple i made a custom rune. I saved it in images then saved it as a spr. How would i get that spr into game? Like when I look at runes and stuff in objectdef fire rune is sprite 30. When i look at the sprite editer the 30.spr is a body. I’m not wanting to just change the color…

Read full topic

[quote=“gawdz666, post:6, topic:338516”]Well if you add a new sprite you will need to load it via the client and set a few things.

If you have no idea what you are doing I’d say don’t.[/quote]

ohai Tommy, what’s up?

Read full topic

yong min:

I actually just re-read your first post. If you are only adding a new color, then you don’t need to create the new sprites for it. My first thought was that you were actually going to be a bit creative and add something 1000 servers haven’t done before.

Ive done it
